template.value: Usage and adoption metrics for all apps and users within the Retool organization. Select a date range to get started.

template.tooltipText: Total count of unique apps who have had at least one query run on them during a given month

template.value:
#### How it works

This app pulls data from the internal Postgres Database backing this Retool instance. Specifically, it queries the `audit_trail_events`, `page_saves`, and `users` tables. 

This app also comes predefined with SQL queries, which you can duplicate and modify to surface whichever adoption metrics you desire. 

#### Notes

###### Avoid large queries! 

If this app is running on a high-usage Retool instance, be sure to avoid running large queries. 

###### Truncating your tables to improve performance

You can truncate these tables by running queries against it. We recommend copying the contents to another (external) DB before doing so to preserve all logs.

template.tooltipText: Total count of unique users who have run at least one query during a given month.

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  page_views as (
    select
      a."pageName" as page_name,
      count(*) as count_page_views,
      count(distinct email) as count_unique_viewers
    from
      audit_trail_events a join users u on u.id = a."userId"
    where
      a."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and a."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
      and a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
    group by
      1
  ),
  page_saves as (
    select
      ps."pageId" as page_id,
      count(*) as count_page_saves,
      count(distinct email) as count_unique_builders
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      ps."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and ps."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and ps."pageId" = any(select id from page_ids)
    group by
      1
  ),
  pages as (
    select
      pages.name,
      pages.id,
      uuid,
      pages."createdAt" as created_at,
      "folderId" as folder_id,
      "isGlobalWidget" as is_module,
      "protected" as protected,
      folders.name as folder_name,
      users.email as last_edited_by
    from
      pages
      left join folders on folders.id = pages."folderId"
      left join users on users.id = pages."lastEditedBy"
    where
      pages.name ilike {{ '%' + ApplicationSearchInput.value + '%' }}
      and folders.name <> 'archive'
      and "isGlobalWidget" = FALSE
      and pages."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
  )
select
  pages.*,
  page_saves.count_page_saves,
  page_saves.count_unique_builders,
  page_views.count_page_views,
  page_views.count_unique_viewers
from
  pages
  left join page_saves on page_saves.page_id = pages.id
  left join page_views on page_views.page_name = pages.name
order by
  count_page_views desc nulls last
limit
  {{ MaxApps.value}};

columnMappers.name: {{self}}

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  page_views as (
    select
      email,
      count(*) as count_page_views
    from
      audit_trail_events a join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
      and a."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and a."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and email is not null 
    group by
      1
  ),
  page_saves as (
    select
      email,
      count(*) as count_page_saves,
      count(distinct ps."pageId") as count_unique_apps
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      ps."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and ps."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
      and email is not null
    group by
      1
  ),
  users as (
    select
      users.email,
      organizations.name as spaceName,
      concat(users."firstName", ' ', users."lastName") as name,
      users."createdAt" as created_at,
      users."profilePhotoUrl" as profile_photo_url,
      users."lastLoggedIn" as last_logged_in
    from
      users join organizations on organizations.id = users."organizationId"
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{organizationIds.data}})
  )
select
  users.*,
  page_saves.count_page_saves,
  page_saves.count_unique_apps,
  page_views.count_page_views
from
  users
  left join page_saves on page_saves.email = users.email
  left join page_views on page_views.email = users.email
where
  name ilike {{ '%' + UserSearchInput.value + '%' }}
order by
  count_page_views desc nulls last
limit
  {{ MaxUsers.value }}

SELECT
  id,
  "createdAt",
  CASE
    WHEN "parentOrgId" IS NULL THEN TRUE
    ELSE FALSE
  END AS is_admin_space,
  CASE
    WHEN "parentOrgId" IS NULL THEN 'Admin Space'
    ELSE NAME
  END AS space_name
FROM
  organizations
WHERE
  enabled = TRUE
  OR (
    enabled IS NULL
    AND "parentOrgId" IS NULL
  )
ORDER BY
  "createdAt" DESC;
template.transformer:
// Query results are available as the `data` variable
return data

template.label: End users (traling 30 days)
template.tooltipText: Total number of unique users who have accessed Retool during last 30 days and have made less than 5 app and workflow saves.

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  workflow_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      workflow
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{organizationIds.data}})
  ),
  page_view_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (a."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_VIEW' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      audit_trail_events a join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and date (a."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (a."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}}) -- this is necessary to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index 
      and a."userId" is not null
      and u.email is not null
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  page_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ps."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      date (ps."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ps."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ps."userId" is not null
      and u.email is not null
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  workflow_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ws."createdAt") as day,
      'WORKFLOW_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      workflow_save ws join users u on ws."createdBy" = u.id
    where
      date (ws."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ws."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ws."createdBy" is not null
      and u.email is not null 
      and ws."workflowId" = any(select id from workflow_ids)
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  all_events as (
    select
      *
    from
      page_view_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      page_save_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      workflow_save_events
  ),
  user_types as (
    select
      users.email,
      "firstName" as first_name,
      "lastName" as last_name,
      case
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type IN ('PAGE_SAVE', 'WORKFLOW_SAVE') then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) >= 5 then 'standard_user'
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type = 'PAGE_VIEW' then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) > 0 then 'end_user'
        else 'none'
      end as user_type
    from
      all_events
      JOIN users ON all_events.email = users.email
    where
      day > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and day <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
    group by
      1,2,3
  )
select
  *,
  MD5(email) as hashed_email
from
  (
    select
      *
    from
      user_types
  ) as all_user_types

template.label: Standard users (trailing 30 days)
template.tooltipText: Total number of unique users who have accessed Retool during the last 30 days and made at least 5 app and workflow saves.

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  workflow_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      workflow
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data}})
  ),
  page_view_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (a."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_VIEW' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      audit_trail_events a
      join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and date (a."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (a."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}}) -- this is necessary to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index  
      and a."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  page_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ps."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      page_saves ps 
      join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      date (ps."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ps."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ps."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  workflow_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ws."createdAt") as day,
      'WORKFLOW_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      workflow_save ws
      join users u on u.id = ws."createdBy"
    where
      date (ws."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ws."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ws."createdBy" is not null
      and email is not null
      and ws."workflowId" = any ( select id from workflow_ids)
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  all_events as (
    select
      *
    from
      page_view_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      page_save_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      workflow_save_events
  ),
  user_types_current as (
    select
      email,
      true as is_current,
      case
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type IN ('PAGE_SAVE', 'WORKFLOW_SAVE') then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) >= 5 then 'builder'
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type = 'PAGE_VIEW' then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) > 0 then 'enduser'
        else 'none'
      end as user_type
    from
      all_events
    where
      day > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and day <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
    group by
      email
  ),
  user_types_previous as (
    select
      email,
      false as is_current,
      case
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type IN ('PAGE_SAVE', 'WORKFLOW_SAVE') then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) >= 5 then 'builder'
        else 'enduser'
      end as user_type
    from
      all_events
    where
      day > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and day <= (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
    group by
      email
  )
select
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'builder'
        and is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countBuilders",
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'enduser'
        and is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countEndUsers",
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'builder'
        and not is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countPrevBuilders",
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'enduser'
        and not is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countPrevEndUsers"
from
  (
    select
      *
    from
      user_types_current
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      user_types_previous
  ) as all_user_types

WITH 
-- auxiliary table with one row per each day in our range
dates AS (
  SELECT d::date AS day
  FROM generate_series(
    to_date({{DateRange.value.start}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    to_date({{DateRange.value.end}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    '1 day'
  ) AS gs(d)
), 
-- get unique tuples "page name - date", one tuple per each user that viewed a page on a given date
-- we need to look at events that happened up to 30 days before our range start, because they'll affect trailing 30d MAU
unique_apps_by_date AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT "pageName", date_trunc('day', "createdAt")::date AS day
  FROM audit_trail_events 
  WHERE 
    "actionType" = ANY({{userActions.value}})
    AND "createdAt" >= (to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 DAYS') AND "createdAt" < {{ DateRange.value.end }}
    AND "organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}}) -- need this to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index
),
-- now we generate one row per each "page name - date" combination where user had been active in 30 days ending on that date
active_apps_30d AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT "pageName", dates.day AS day
  FROM dates JOIN unique_apps_by_date
  ON dates.day >= unique_apps_by_date.day AND dates.day < unique_apps_by_date.day + 30
),
-- all we're left to do is to count distinct "30d active" users for each date in our range
trailing_30d_maas AS (
  SELECT dates.day, COUNT(DISTINCT "pageName") AS MAA
  FROM dates LEFT JOIN active_apps_30d
  ON dates.day = active_apps_30d.day
  WHERE dates.day >= {{DateRange.value.start}} AND dates.day <= {{DateRange.value.end}}
  GROUP BY dates.day
)
SELECT * FROM trailing_30d_maas
SELECT DISTINCT id FROM organizations where id = any({{ SpaceSelector.value }})

with 

page_views_top as (

  select
    email,
    concat(u."firstName", ' ', u."lastName") as user_name,
    count(*) as count_page_views
  from audit_trail_events a 
  left join users u
  on u.id = a."userId"
  
  where 
    a."organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}})
    and a."createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start}}
    and a."createdAt" < {{ currentTimeRange.value.end}}
    and a."pageName" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.name }}
    and a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
  group by 1, 2

)

select * from page_views_top
where user_name <> ' '
order by count_page_views desc nulls last
limit 5

WITH 
-- auxiliary table with one row per each day in our range
dates AS (
  SELECT d::date AS day
  FROM generate_series(
    to_date({{DateRange.value.start}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    to_date({{DateRange.value.end}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    '1 day'
  ) AS gs(d)
), 
-- get unique tuples "user id - date", one tuple per each user that viewed a page on a given date
-- we need to look at events that happened up to 30 days before our range start, because they'll affect trailing 30d MAU
unique_users_by_date AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT email, date_trunc('day', a."createdAt")::date AS day
  FROM audit_trail_events a join users u on u.id = a."userId"
  WHERE 
    a."actionType" = ANY({{userActions.value}})
    AND a."createdAt" >= (to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 DAYS') AND a."createdAt" < {{ DateRange.value.end }}
    AND a."organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}}) -- need this to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index
),
-- now we generate one row per each "user id - date" combination where user had been active in 30 days ending on that date
active_users_30d AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT email, dates.day AS day
  FROM dates JOIN unique_users_by_date
  ON dates.day >= unique_users_by_date.day AND dates.day < unique_users_by_date.day + 30
),
-- all we're left to do is to count distinct "30d active" users for each date in our range
trailing_30d_maus AS (
  SELECT dates.day, COUNT(DISTINCT email) AS MAU
  FROM dates LEFT JOIN active_users_30d
  ON dates.day = active_users_30d.day
  WHERE dates.day >= {{DateRange.value.start}} AND dates.day <= {{DateRange.value.end}}
  GROUP BY dates.day
)
SELECT * FROM trailing_30d_maus

template.label: App saves
template.tooltipText: Total number of app saves across all apps during this time period

template.label: App views
template.tooltipText: Total number of app views across all apps during this time period

template.query:
with 

page_saves_top as (

  select
    email,
    concat(u."firstName", ' ', u."lastName") as user_name,
    count(*) as count_page_saves
  from page_saves ps
  left join users u 
  on u.id = ps."userId"
  where ps."pageId" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
  and ps."createdAt" >= {{currentTimeRange.value.start}}
  and ps."createdAt" < {{currentTimeRange.value.end}}
  group by 1, 2

)

select * from page_saves_top
where user_name <> ' '
order by count_page_saves desc nulls last
limit 5

with
  page_saves as (
    select
      date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
      count(*) as count_page_saves
    from
      page_saves
    where
      "pageId" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
      AND "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
    group by
      1
  ),
  page_views as (
    select
      date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
      count(*) as count_page_views
    from
      audit_trail_events
    where
      "organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
      and "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and "pageName" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.name }}
      and "actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
    group by
      1
  )
select
  page_saves.*,
  page_views.count_page_views
from
  page_saves
  left join page_views on page_views.week = page_saves.week
where
  page_saves.week > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}

with 
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  top_apps as (
-- get top applications by number of page saves
  select
    "pageId" as page_id,
    pages.name as page_name,
    count(*) as count_page_saves
  from page_saves
  left join pages
  on pages.id = page_saves."pageId"
  
  -- filter for user 
  where "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
  and page_saves."createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start}}
  and page_saves."createdAt" < {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
  and "pageId" = any (select id from page_ids)
  group by 1, 2

)

select * from top_apps
order by count_page_saves desc nulls last

with

page_views as (
	-- get number of page views all time for user
  select
    "pageName" as page_name,
    count(*) as count_page_views
  from audit_trail_events

  where 
    "organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}})
    and "createdAt" >= {{currentTimeRange.value.start}}
    and "createdAt" < {{currentTimeRange.value.end}}
    and "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
    and "actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
  group by 1

)

select * from page_views
order by count_page_views desc nulls last

with 

page_saves as (
-- get number of page saves per week for selected user
  select
    date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
    count(*) as count_page_saves
  from page_saves
  
  where "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
  and "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
  group by 1

),

page_views as (
-- get number of page views per week for selected user
  
  select
    date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
    count(*) as count_page_views
  from audit_trail_events

  where 
    "organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}})
    and "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
    and "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
    and "actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
  group by 1

)

select
  page_saves.*,
  page_views.count_page_views
from page_saves 
left join page_views
  on page_views.week = page_saves.week

where
  page_saves.week > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}

with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  workflow_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      workflow
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data}})
  ),
  -- auxiliary table with one row per each day in our range
  dates as (
    select
      d::date AS day
    from
      generate_series(
        to_date({{DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 DAYS',
        to_date({{DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
        '1 day'
      ) as gs (d)
  ),
  -- we select all the relevant events in our target range + 30 days before the start date
  -- this is mostly to avoid having to query by dates and org sids in other subqueries
  page_view_events as (
    select
      email,
      date (a."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_VIEW' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      audit_trail_events a 
      join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and date (a."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and date (a."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}}) -- this is necessary to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index  
      and a."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  page_save_events as (
    select
      email,
      date (ps."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on u.id = ps."userId" -- Fix here: user.id -> u.id
    where
      date (ps."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and date (ps."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ps."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
)
select * from page_view_events;

template.value: Usage and adoption metrics for all apps and users within the Retool organization. Select a date range to get started.

template.tooltipText: Total count of unique apps who have had at least one query run on them during a given month

template.value:
#### How it works

This app pulls data from the internal Postgres Database backing this Retool instance. Specifically, it queries the `audit_trail_events`, `page_saves`, and `users` tables. 

This app also comes predefined with SQL queries, which you can duplicate and modify to surface whichever adoption metrics you desire. 

#### Notes

###### Avoid large queries! 

If this app is running on a high-usage Retool instance, be sure to avoid running large queries. 

###### Truncating your tables to improve performance

You can truncate these tables by running queries against it. We recommend copying the contents to another (external) DB before doing so to preserve all logs.

template.tooltipText: Total count of unique users who have run at least one query during a given month.

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  page_views as (
    select
      a."pageName" as page_name,
      count(*) as count_page_views,
      count(distinct email) as count_unique_viewers
    from
      audit_trail_events a join users u on u.id = a."userId"
    where
      a."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and a."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
      and a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
    group by
      1
  ),
  page_saves as (
    select
      ps."pageId" as page_id,
      count(*) as count_page_saves,
      count(distinct email) as count_unique_builders
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      ps."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and ps."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and ps."pageId" = any(select id from page_ids)
    group by
      1
  ),
  pages as (
    select
      pages.name,
      pages.id,
      uuid,
      pages."createdAt" as created_at,
      "folderId" as folder_id,
      "isGlobalWidget" as is_module,
      "protected" as protected,
      folders.name as folder_name,
      users.email as last_edited_by
    from
      pages
      left join folders on folders.id = pages."folderId"
      left join users on users.id = pages."lastEditedBy"
    where
      pages.name ilike {{ '%' + ApplicationSearchInput.value + '%' }}
      and folders.name <> 'archive'
      and "isGlobalWidget" = FALSE
      and pages."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
  )
select
  pages.*,
  page_saves.count_page_saves,
  page_saves.count_unique_builders,
  page_views.count_page_views,
  page_views.count_unique_viewers
from
  pages
  left join page_saves on page_saves.page_id = pages.id
  left join page_views on page_views.page_name = pages.name
order by
  count_page_views desc nulls last
limit
  {{ MaxApps.value}};

columnMappers.name: {{self}}

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  page_views as (
    select
      email,
      count(*) as count_page_views
    from
      audit_trail_events a join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
      and a."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and a."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and email is not null 
    group by
      1
  ),
  page_saves as (
    select
      email,
      count(*) as count_page_saves,
      count(distinct ps."pageId") as count_unique_apps
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      ps."createdAt" <= {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
      and ps."createdAt" > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
      and email is not null
    group by
      1
  ),
  users as (
    select
      users.email,
      organizations.name as spaceName,
      concat(users."firstName", ' ', users."lastName") as name,
      users."createdAt" as created_at,
      users."profilePhotoUrl" as profile_photo_url,
      users."lastLoggedIn" as last_logged_in
    from
      users join organizations on organizations.id = users."organizationId"
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{organizationIds.data}})
  )
select
  users.*,
  page_saves.count_page_saves,
  page_saves.count_unique_apps,
  page_views.count_page_views
from
  users
  left join page_saves on page_saves.email = users.email
  left join page_views on page_views.email = users.email
where
  name ilike {{ '%' + UserSearchInput.value + '%' }}
order by
  count_page_views desc nulls last
limit
  {{ MaxUsers.value }}

SELECT
  id,
  "createdAt",
  CASE
    WHEN "parentOrgId" IS NULL THEN TRUE
    ELSE FALSE
  END AS is_admin_space,
  CASE
    WHEN "parentOrgId" IS NULL THEN 'Admin Space'
    ELSE NAME
  END AS space_name
FROM
  organizations
WHERE
  enabled = TRUE
  OR (
    enabled IS NULL
    AND "parentOrgId" IS NULL
  )
ORDER BY
  "createdAt" DESC;
template.transformer:
// Query results are available as the `data` variable
return data

template.label: End users (traling 30 days)
template.tooltipText: Total number of unique users who have accessed Retool during last 30 days and have made less than 5 app and workflow saves.

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  workflow_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      workflow
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{organizationIds.data}})
  ),
  page_view_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (a."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_VIEW' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      audit_trail_events a join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and date (a."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (a."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}}) -- this is necessary to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index 
      and a."userId" is not null
      and u.email is not null
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  page_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ps."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      date (ps."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ps."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ps."userId" is not null
      and u.email is not null
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  workflow_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ws."createdAt") as day,
      'WORKFLOW_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      workflow_save ws join users u on ws."createdBy" = u.id
    where
      date (ws."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ws."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ws."createdBy" is not null
      and u.email is not null 
      and ws."workflowId" = any(select id from workflow_ids)
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  all_events as (
    select
      *
    from
      page_view_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      page_save_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      workflow_save_events
  ),
  user_types as (
    select
      users.email,
      "firstName" as first_name,
      "lastName" as last_name,
      case
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type IN ('PAGE_SAVE', 'WORKFLOW_SAVE') then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) >= 5 then 'standard_user'
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type = 'PAGE_VIEW' then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) > 0 then 'end_user'
        else 'none'
      end as user_type
    from
      all_events
      JOIN users ON all_events.email = users.email
    where
      day > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and day <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
    group by
      1,2,3
  )
select
  *,
  MD5(email) as hashed_email
from
  (
    select
      *
    from
      user_types
  ) as all_user_types

template.label: Standard users (trailing 30 days)
template.tooltipText: Total number of unique users who have accessed Retool during the last 30 days and made at least 5 app and workflow saves.

template.query:
with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  workflow_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      workflow
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data}})
  ),
  page_view_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (a."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_VIEW' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      audit_trail_events a
      join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and date (a."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (a."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}}) -- this is necessary to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index  
      and a."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  page_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ps."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      page_saves ps 
      join users u on ps."userId" = u.id
    where
      date (ps."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ps."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ps."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  workflow_save_events as (
    select
      u.email,
      date (ws."createdAt") as day,
      'WORKFLOW_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      workflow_save ws
      join users u on u.id = ws."createdBy"
    where
      date (ws."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and date (ws."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ws."createdBy" is not null
      and email is not null
      and ws."workflowId" = any ( select id from workflow_ids)
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  all_events as (
    select
      *
    from
      page_view_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      page_save_events
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      workflow_save_events
  ),
  user_types_current as (
    select
      email,
      true as is_current,
      case
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type IN ('PAGE_SAVE', 'WORKFLOW_SAVE') then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) >= 5 then 'builder'
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type = 'PAGE_VIEW' then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) > 0 then 'enduser'
        else 'none'
      end as user_type
    from
      all_events
    where
      day > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and day <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
    group by
      email
  ),
  user_types_previous as (
    select
      email,
      false as is_current,
      case
        when sum(
          case
            when event_type IN ('PAGE_SAVE', 'WORKFLOW_SAVE') then event_cnt
            else 0
          end
        ) >= 5 then 'builder'
        else 'enduser'
      end as user_type
    from
      all_events
    where
      day > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '60 days'
      )
      and day <= (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
    group by
      email
  )
select
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'builder'
        and is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countBuilders",
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'enduser'
        and is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countEndUsers",
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'builder'
        and not is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countPrevBuilders",
  coalesce(
    sum(
      case
        when user_type = 'enduser'
        and not is_current then 1
        else 0
      end
    ),
    0
  ) as "countPrevEndUsers"
from
  (
    select
      *
    from
      user_types_current
    union all
    select
      *
    from
      user_types_previous
  ) as all_user_types

WITH 
-- auxiliary table with one row per each day in our range
dates AS (
  SELECT d::date AS day
  FROM generate_series(
    to_date({{DateRange.value.start}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    to_date({{DateRange.value.end}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    '1 day'
  ) AS gs(d)
), 
-- get unique tuples "page name - date", one tuple per each user that viewed a page on a given date
-- we need to look at events that happened up to 30 days before our range start, because they'll affect trailing 30d MAU
unique_apps_by_date AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT "pageName", date_trunc('day', "createdAt")::date AS day
  FROM audit_trail_events 
  WHERE 
    "actionType" = ANY({{userActions.value}})
    AND "createdAt" >= (to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 DAYS') AND "createdAt" < {{ DateRange.value.end }}
    AND "organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}}) -- need this to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index
),
-- now we generate one row per each "page name - date" combination where user had been active in 30 days ending on that date
active_apps_30d AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT "pageName", dates.day AS day
  FROM dates JOIN unique_apps_by_date
  ON dates.day >= unique_apps_by_date.day AND dates.day < unique_apps_by_date.day + 30
),
-- all we're left to do is to count distinct "30d active" users for each date in our range
trailing_30d_maas AS (
  SELECT dates.day, COUNT(DISTINCT "pageName") AS MAA
  FROM dates LEFT JOIN active_apps_30d
  ON dates.day = active_apps_30d.day
  WHERE dates.day >= {{DateRange.value.start}} AND dates.day <= {{DateRange.value.end}}
  GROUP BY dates.day
)
SELECT * FROM trailing_30d_maas
SELECT DISTINCT id FROM organizations where id = any({{ SpaceSelector.value }})

with 

page_views_top as (

  select
    email,
    concat(u."firstName", ' ', u."lastName") as user_name,
    count(*) as count_page_views
  from audit_trail_events a 
  left join users u
  on u.id = a."userId"
  
  where 
    a."organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}})
    and a."createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start}}
    and a."createdAt" < {{ currentTimeRange.value.end}}
    and a."pageName" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.name }}
    and a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
  group by 1, 2

)

select * from page_views_top
where user_name <> ' '
order by count_page_views desc nulls last
limit 5

WITH 
-- auxiliary table with one row per each day in our range
dates AS (
  SELECT d::date AS day
  FROM generate_series(
    to_date({{DateRange.value.start}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    to_date({{DateRange.value.end}}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
    '1 day'
  ) AS gs(d)
), 
-- get unique tuples "user id - date", one tuple per each user that viewed a page on a given date
-- we need to look at events that happened up to 30 days before our range start, because they'll affect trailing 30d MAU
unique_users_by_date AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT email, date_trunc('day', a."createdAt")::date AS day
  FROM audit_trail_events a join users u on u.id = a."userId"
  WHERE 
    a."actionType" = ANY({{userActions.value}})
    AND a."createdAt" >= (to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 DAYS') AND a."createdAt" < {{ DateRange.value.end }}
    AND a."organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}}) -- need this to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index
),
-- now we generate one row per each "user id - date" combination where user had been active in 30 days ending on that date
active_users_30d AS (
  SELECT DISTINCT email, dates.day AS day
  FROM dates JOIN unique_users_by_date
  ON dates.day >= unique_users_by_date.day AND dates.day < unique_users_by_date.day + 30
),
-- all we're left to do is to count distinct "30d active" users for each date in our range
trailing_30d_maus AS (
  SELECT dates.day, COUNT(DISTINCT email) AS MAU
  FROM dates LEFT JOIN active_users_30d
  ON dates.day = active_users_30d.day
  WHERE dates.day >= {{DateRange.value.start}} AND dates.day <= {{DateRange.value.end}}
  GROUP BY dates.day
)
SELECT * FROM trailing_30d_maus

template.label: App saves
template.tooltipText: Total number of app saves across all apps during this time period

template.label: App views
template.tooltipText: Total number of app views across all apps during this time period

template.query:
with 

page_saves_top as (

  select
    email,
    concat(u."firstName", ' ', u."lastName") as user_name,
    count(*) as count_page_saves
  from page_saves ps
  left join users u 
  on u.id = ps."userId"
  where ps."pageId" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
  and ps."createdAt" >= {{currentTimeRange.value.start}}
  and ps."createdAt" < {{currentTimeRange.value.end}}
  group by 1, 2

)

select * from page_saves_top
where user_name <> ' '
order by count_page_saves desc nulls last
limit 5

with
  page_saves as (
    select
      date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
      count(*) as count_page_saves
    from
      page_saves
    where
      "pageId" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
      AND "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
    group by
      1
  ),
  page_views as (
    select
      date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
      count(*) as count_page_views
    from
      audit_trail_events
    where
      "organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}})
      and "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
      and "pageName" = {{ AppTable.selectedRow.data.name }}
      and "actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
    group by
      1
  )
select
  page_saves.*,
  page_views.count_page_views
from
  page_saves
  left join page_views on page_views.week = page_saves.week
where
  page_saves.week > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}

with 
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  top_apps as (
-- get top applications by number of page saves
  select
    "pageId" as page_id,
    pages.name as page_name,
    count(*) as count_page_saves
  from page_saves
  left join pages
  on pages.id = page_saves."pageId"
  
  -- filter for user 
  where "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
  and page_saves."createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start}}
  and page_saves."createdAt" < {{ currentTimeRange.value.end }}
  and "pageId" = any (select id from page_ids)
  group by 1, 2

)

select * from top_apps
order by count_page_saves desc nulls last

with

page_views as (
	-- get number of page views all time for user
  select
    "pageName" as page_name,
    count(*) as count_page_views
  from audit_trail_events

  where 
    "organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}})
    and "createdAt" >= {{currentTimeRange.value.start}}
    and "createdAt" < {{currentTimeRange.value.end}}
    and "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
    and "actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
  group by 1

)

select * from page_views
order by count_page_views desc nulls last

with 

page_saves as (
-- get number of page saves per week for selected user
  select
    date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
    count(*) as count_page_saves
  from page_saves
  
  where "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
  and "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
  group by 1

),

page_views as (
-- get number of page views per week for selected user
  
  select
    date_trunc('week', "createdAt") as week,
    count(*) as count_page_views
  from audit_trail_events

  where 
    "organizationId" = ANY({{organizationIds.data}})
    and "createdAt" >= {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}
    and "userId" = {{ UsersTable.selectedRow.data.id }}
    and "actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
  group by 1

)

select
  page_saves.*,
  page_views.count_page_views
from page_saves 
left join page_views
  on page_views.week = page_saves.week

where
  page_saves.week > {{ currentTimeRange.value.start }}

with
  page_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      pages
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data }})
  ),
  workflow_ids as (
    select
      id
    from
      workflow
    where
      "organizationId" = any ({{ organizationIds.data}})
  ),
  -- auxiliary table with one row per each day in our range
  dates as (
    select
      d::date AS day
    from
      generate_series(
        to_date({{DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 DAYS',
        to_date({{DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD'),
        '1 day'
      ) as gs (d)
  ),
  -- we select all the relevant events in our target range + 30 days before the start date
  -- this is mostly to avoid having to query by dates and org sids in other subqueries
  page_view_events as (
    select
      email,
      date (a."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_VIEW' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      audit_trail_events a 
      join users u on a."userId" = u.id
    where
      a."actionType" = 'PAGE_VIEW'
      and date (a."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and date (a."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and a."organizationId" = ANY ({{organizationIds.data}}) -- this is necessary to hit (organizationId, createdAt) index  
      and a."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
  ),
  page_save_events as (
    select
      email,
      date (ps."createdAt") as day,
      'PAGE_SAVE' as event_type,
      count(1) as event_cnt
    from
      page_saves ps join users u on u.id = ps."userId" -- Fix here: user.id -> u.id
    where
      date (ps."createdAt") > (
        to_date({{ DateRange.value.start }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD') - INTERVAL '30 days'
      )
      and date (ps."createdAt") <= to_date({{ DateRange.value.end }}, 'YYYY-MM-DD')
      and ps."userId" is not null
      and email is not null
      and ps."pageId" = any (
        select
          id
        from
          page_ids
      )
    group by
      1,
      2,
      3
)
select * from page_view_events;
